Package ca.concordia.controller.map

Class ValidateMap

java.lang.Object
ca.concordia.controller.map.ValidateMap
public class ValidateMap
extends java.lang.Object
Class ValidateMap is used to check whether the given map is directed graph or not. If it is directed graph then it is valid map. DFS algorithm is used to check the connectivity of graph.\

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ValidateMap​(Map p_Map)
    This method load the map in ValidateMap class as it is constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean validate()
    this method checks if no continent and countries are present in a map Then return as output that no countries and continents are available for our game.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • ValidateMap

      public ValidateMap​(Map p_Map)
      This method load the map in ValidateMap class as it is constructor. Constructor is automatically called whenever class is called.
      Parameters:
      p_Map - map is passed as parameter which is to be validated.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      public boolean validate()
      this method checks if no continent and countries are present in a map Then return as output that no countries and continents are available for our game. Additionally, It check if there are duplicates countries and continents are present or not Also,using Depth First Search checking whether graph is connected or not.
      Returns:
      the boolean false value to show it is invalid map or true if map is valid.
